oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1857 saber and scabbard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Model 1857 saber and scabbard dated 1863. The saber belonged to someone in the Staggs family in Wayne County, Tenn. Made by Ames in Chicoppee, Mass. and inspected by A.D.M. The Model 1857 was the common saber for the Union cavalry during the Civil War. Confederate cavalrymen also used captured weapons of this type. The model 1857 is often referred to as the model 1860 light cavalry saber.
